cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles ENE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west then west-southwest toward the south-central Texas coast and inland across south Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Corpus Christi to Baffin Bay, TX (within the Port Mansfield–Mesquite Bay hurricane-warning area)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mesquite Bay to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas Gulf Coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island, including Matagorda and Calhoun counties
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) are possible at the port beginning late morning into Saturday evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground level possible inside Matagorda and San Antonio Bays, including port facilities.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain likely with locally higher totals, creating flash-flood potential and operational impacts.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and an isolated tornado threat across the middle Texas coastal plain.
